page.title: 08Bluebell Walk, Bates Farm.
page.content: Each year, when the bluebells are in flower, a woodland walk is open to the public at Bates Green Farm on otherwise private property. Profits from entrance fees go to local causes such as, this year, towards the cost of building a new village hall in Arlington. Refreshment stalls are manned by volunteers from local charities which benefit from the proceeds. The barn houses an exhibition staged by the local village school. The walk is a popular family attraction and is very widely publicised. This farmer has received an award for conservation of wildlife on his farm.
